xcsf
Class PerformanceEvaluator

java.lang.Object
  xcsf.PerformanceEvaluator

public class PerformanceEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates all performance related methods and offers methods to write performance files.

Author:
Patrick O. Stalph, Martin V. Butz

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

PerformanceEvaluator

PerformanceEvaluator(boolean verbose)
Default constructor.

Parameters:
verbose - determines if the performance should be printed to System.out.
Method Detail

getCurrentExperimentPerformance

double[][] getCurrentExperimentPerformance()
Returns the performance of the current experiment. Note that this method returns the complete array, even if not filled with values!

You will find null entries in the last dimension, if the performance is not evaluated, yet.

Returns:
performance array of the current experiment.

nextExperiment

void nextExperiment()
Indicates, that the next experiment has begun.

evaluate

void evaluate(Population population,
              MatchSet matchSet,
              int iteration,
              double[] noiselessFunctionValue,
              double[] functionPrediction)
Evaluates the performance.

Parameters:
population - the current population.
matchSet - the current matchset.
iteration - the current iteration.
noiselessFunctionValue - the current noiseless functionvalue, if available.
functionPrediction - the xcsf prediction.

writeAvgPerformance

void writeAvgPerformance(java.lang.String file)
Writes the average performance (averaged over all experiments) to the given file.

Parameters:
file - the file.
